title: Primitive Values and Reference Values
description: The Primitive Values, such as numbers, strings, are immutable and passed by value, while the Reference Values, such as objects and arrays, are mutable and passed by reference.
content: The primitive values are immutable and include types, such as `number`, `string`, `boolean`, `null`, `undefined`, `symbol` and `bigint`. The reference values, on the other hand, are objects, arrays and functions. Unlike primitives, reference values are mutable and compared by reference, not by value.
